def _get_grouper(
    obj,
    key=None,
    axis=0,
    level=None,
    sort=True,
    observed=False,
    mutated=False,
    validate=True,
):
    group_axis = obj._get_axis(axis)

    if level is not None:
        if isinstance(key, str):
            try:
                # Get the specified column from the DataFrame
                key = group_axis.get_loc(key)
            except KeyError:
                pass  # Column not found, proceed further

    if isinstance(key, str):
        key = [key]  # Convert single string key to list for consistency

    if not isinstance(key, list):
        key = com.asarray_tuplesafe(key)

    # Create the Grouping objects for each key
    groupings = [
        Grouping(
            group_axis,
            key_val,
            obj=obj,
            name=key_val,
            level=None,
            sort=sort,
            observed=observed,
            in_axis=True,
        )
        for key_val in key
    ]

    grouper = BaseGrouper(group_axis, groupings, sort=sort, mutated=mutated)
    return grouper, [], obj
